text.0: ye waters are beneficent so help ye us to energy.
text.1: that we may look on great delight.
text.2: give us a portion of the sap the most auspicious that ye have.
text.3: like mothers in their longing love.
text.4: to you we gladly come for him to whose abode ye send us on.
text.5: and waters give us procreant strength.
text.6: the waters be to us for drink goddesses for our aid and bliss.
text.7: let them stream to us health and strength.
text.8: beg the floods to give us balm these queens who rule oer precious things.
text.9: and have supreme control of men.
text.10: within the waterssoma thus hath told medwell all balms that heal.
text.11: and agni he who blesseth all.
text.12: o waters teem with medicine to keep my body safe from harm.
text.13: so that i long may see the sun.
text.14: whatever sin is found in me whatever evil i have wrought.
text.15: if i have lied or falsely sworn waters remove it far from me.
text.16: the waters i this day have sought and to their moisture have we come.
text.17: o agni rich in milk come thou and with thy splendour cover me.
